title: Taking LNUG offline
description:
I’ve alway been keen to provide a good offline experience for the LNUG website. We already use AppCache with the help of app-cache-nanny but with its upcoming depreciation I’ve been investigating how service workers might improve the experience as well as as ensuring the site continues to work when you’re offline.

In this talk I will discuss how the LNUG websites uses appCache and services workers, the things I’ve learned along the way and what we can still improve the experience.

I'm a remote Javascript engineer, part time conference organiser and my opinions can often be found on twitter: @simonmcmanus.
name: Simon McManus
